## Cleaning Data and create new dataframes for demographics and analysis
```{r importing data, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}

#rm(list = ls())

######################################   Read in data from study 1
data1 <- read.csv("Study1.csv")
data1 <- data1 %>% filter(!is.na(data1$FL_388_DO_FL_389)) # remove those who didn't complete the study
  
####### create separate dataframe for demographics
df.desc1<-data1 %>% 
  select(Duration..in.seconds., Age, Age_1_TEXT, Gender, Ethnicity)

###### create dataframe for analysis
data1<- data1 %>% 
    select(c(9, 23:301))


######################################     Read in data from study 2
data2 <- read.csv("Study2.csv")
data2 <- data2 %>% 
  filter(row_number() > 2) %>% # additional rows 
    filter(Age!="") #remove those who didn't complete the study
  
####### create separate dataframe for demographics
df.desc2<-data2 %>% 
  select(Duration..in.seconds., Age, Age_1_TEXT, Gender, Ethnicity)

## create dataframe for analysis
data2<- data2 %>% 
      select(c(ResponseId, a_n_dv_1:u_i_sk_1))

```

##### Descriptive Statistics of combined data from study 1 and study 2
```{r}
##### Combine dataframes
df.desc_combined <- rbind(df.desc1, df.desc2) 
  
df.desc_sum <-df.desc_combined %>% 
   mutate(Duration..in.seconds.=as.numeric(Duration..in.seconds.)) %>% 
    summarise(n=n(),
             female=sum(Gender=="Female" | Gender=="1"),
             not_say=sum(Gender=="Prefer not to say" | Gender=="4"),
             non_binary=sum(Gender=="Non-binary" | Gender=="3"),
             mean_time=mean(Duration..in.seconds./60),
             sd_time=sd(Duration..in.seconds./60)) 

### add age
 df.desc_sum$age<- df.desc_combined %>% 
  #select(Age_1_TEXT) %>% 
  filter(!is.na(as.numeric((Age_1_TEXT)))) %>% 
    mutate(Age_1_TEXT=as.numeric(Age_1_TEXT)) %>% 
  filter(Age_1_TEXT < 90) %>%  ##filter out people who confused this with year of birth
     summarise(mean = mean(Age_1_TEXT, na.rm=TRUE),
             std=sd(Age_1_TEXT, na.rm=TRUE))
```

## Edit data from study 1 and 2
```{r}
####### Edit data from study 1
ld1 <- data1 %>%
  gather(condition, response, -ResponseId) %>%
  mutate(Study = substr(condition, 1, 1), 
         Study = factor(Study),
         Study = factor(studies[Study])) %>%
  filter(!is.na(response)) %>%
  mutate(Scenario = case_when(
    str_detect(condition, "_n_") ~ "Neutral",
    str_detect(condition, "_v_") ~ "Intentional Violation",
    str_detect(condition, "_i_") ~ "Ignorant"
  )) %>%
  mutate (QuestionType = case_when(
    str_detect(condition, "_vn_") ~ "Vignette",
    str_detect(condition, "_kc_") ~ "Knowledge Check",
    str_detect(condition, "_sk_") ~ "Should Know",
    str_detect(condition, "_r_") ~ "Relevance",
    TRUE ~ "Dependent Variable"
  )) %>%
  mutate(OtherCondition = case_when(
    str_detect(condition, "_c_") ~ "Conjunctive",
    str_detect(condition, "_d_") ~ "Disjunctive",
    str_detect(condition, "_a_") ~ "Active",
    str_detect(condition, "_p_") ~ "Passive",
    Study == "Szabo & Knobe, 2003, pens" & str_detect(condition, "_dv1_") ~ "Professor",
    Study == "Szabo & Knobe, 2003, pens" & str_detect(condition, "_dv2_") ~ "Administrative Assistant",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, chairman" & str_detect(condition, "_dv1_") ~ "Desire",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, chairman" & str_detect(condition, "_dv2_") ~ "Decide",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, manager" & str_detect(condition, "_dv1_") ~ "Advocate",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, manager" & str_detect(condition, "_dv2_") ~ "In favor of",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, bomb" & str_detect(condition, "_dv1_") ~ "Intended to",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, bomb" & str_detect(condition, "_dv2_") ~ "Wanted to",
    TRUE ~ "None"
  ))

####### Edit data from study 2
ld2 <- data2 %>% gather(condition, response, -ResponseId) %>%
  mutate(Study = substr(condition, 1, 1), 
         Study = factor(Study),
         Study = factor(studies[Study])) %>%
  filter(response!= "") %>%
  mutate(Scenario = case_when(
    str_detect(condition, "_n_") ~ "Neutral",
    str_detect(condition, "_v_") ~ "Intentional Violation",
    str_detect(condition, "_i_") ~ "Ignorant"
  )) %>%
  mutate (QuestionType = case_when(
    str_detect(condition, "_vn_") ~ "Vignette",
    str_detect(condition, "_kc_") ~ "Knowledge Check",
    str_detect(condition, "_sk_") ~ "Should Know",
    str_detect(condition, "_r_") ~ "Relevance",
    str_detect(condition, "_cfa_") ~ "CF Action", #additional counterfactual question
    str_detect(condition, "_cfe_") ~ "CF Epistemic",#additional counterfactual question
    str_detect(condition, "_check1") ~ "Check 1",
    str_detect(condition, "_check2") ~ "Check 2",
    TRUE ~ "Dependent Variable"
  )) %>%
  mutate(OtherCondition = case_when(
    str_detect(condition, "_c_") ~ "Conjunctive",
    str_detect(condition, "_d_") ~ "Disjunctive",
    str_detect(condition, "_a_") ~ "Active",
    str_detect(condition, "_p_") ~ "Passive",
    Study == "Szabo & Knobe, 2003, pens" & str_detect(condition, "_dv1_") ~ "Professor",
    Study == "Szabo & Knobe, 2003, pens" & str_detect(condition, "_dv2_") ~ "Administrative Assistant",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, chairman" & str_detect(condition, "_dv1_") ~ "Desire",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, chairman" & str_detect(condition, "_dv2_") ~ "Decide",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, manager" & str_detect(condition, "_dv1_") ~ "Advocate",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, manager" & str_detect(condition, "_dv2_") ~ "In favor of",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, bomb" & str_detect(condition, "_dv1_") ~ "Intended to",
    Study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, bomb" & str_detect(condition, "_dv2_") ~ "Wanted to",
    TRUE ~ "None"
  )) %>% 
  mutate(response=as.numeric(response))

```


##Filter participants from the Kominsky & Phillips, 2019 studies in Study 2 based on comprehension check questions
```{r}
kp2019_studies <- ld2 %>%  filter(str_detect(Study, "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019")) 

################################## Create Filter

kp2019_studies <- kp2019_studies %>%
  mutate(Filter1 = case_when(
    Study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, computer" & Scenario == "Intentional Violation" & QuestionType == "Check 1" &  response == "3" ~ "Correct",
    Study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, computer" & Scenario == "Ignorant" & QuestionType == "Check 1" &  response == "3" ~ "Correct",
    Scenario == "Neutral" & QuestionType == "Check 1" &  response == "4" ~ "Correct",
    Study != "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, computer"& Scenario == "Intentional Violation" & QuestionType == "Check 1" &  response == "2" ~ "Correct",
    Study != "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, computer"& Scenario == "Ignorant" & QuestionType == "Check 1" &  response == "2" ~ "Correct",
    TRUE ~ "False"
  )) %>%
  mutate(Filter2 = case_when(
  Study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, bridge" & OtherCondition=="Conjunctive" & QuestionType == "Check 2" &  response == "1" ~ "Correct",
  Study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, bridge" &  OtherCondition=="Disjunctive" & QuestionType == "Check 2" &  response == "2" ~ "Correct",
  Study != "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, bridge" &OtherCondition=="Conjunctive" & QuestionType == "Check 2" &  response == "2" ~ "Correct",
  Study != "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, bridge"& OtherCondition== "Disjunctive" & QuestionType == "Check 2" &  response == "1" ~ "Correct",
    TRUE ~ "False"
  )) %>%
  group_by(ResponseId) %>%
  mutate(FilterTotal = ifelse(any(Filter1 == "Correct") & any(Filter2 == "Correct"),"Correct","False"))

           
######################################### Apply filter
kp2019_studies<-kp2019_studies%>% 
  filter(FilterTotal =="Correct") %>% 
  select(-Filter1, -Filter2, -FilterTotal)

######################################## Add filtered participants to Study 2
ld2 <-ld2 %>% 
  filter(!str_detect(Study, "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019")) %>% 
  rbind(kp2019_studies)
```

## Phillips & Knobe 2009

```{r PK2009, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}

pk2009 <- ld %>% filter(Study == "Phillips & Knobe, 2009")

######################################## Descriptives All Ratings

# Original
### Neutral + Ignorant
pk2009_statsrep <- pk2009 %>% filter(Scenario == "Neutral" | Scenario == "Intentional Violation") %>%
  group_by(QuestionType, Scenario) %>% summarise(mean=mean(response), 
                                   sd=sd(response), 
                                   n=length(response))
# New 
### Neutral + Intentional Violation
pk2009_statsnew <- pk2009 %>% filter(Scenario == "Neutral" | Scenario == "Ignorant") %>%
  group_by(QuestionType, Scenario) %>% summarise(mean=mean(response), 
                                   sd=sd(response), 
                                   n=length(response))

############################################## DV Rating

############ Original

## We will examine if original effect is replicated

pk2009_reptest <- t.test(pk2009$response[pk2009$Scenario == "Neutral" & pk2009$QuestionType == "Dependent Variable"],
                         pk2009$response[pk2009$Scenario == "Intentional Violation" & pk2009$QuestionType == "Dependent Variable"])

##Replicated? Yes! 

pk2009_repEffect <- cohens_d(pk2009$response[pk2009$Scenario == "Neutral" & pk2009$QuestionType == "Dependent Variable"],
                         pk2009$response[pk2009$Scenario == "Intentional Violation" & pk2009$QuestionType == "Dependent Variable"])

## putting replication effects in the meta-analysis table

mtable$repEffect[mtable$study=="Phillips & Knobe, 2009"] <- pk2009_repEffect$Cohens_d
mtable$repEffectCIh[mtable$study=="Phillips & Knobe, 2009"] <- pk2009_repEffect$CI_high
mtable$repEffectCIl[mtable$study=="Phillips & Knobe, 2009"] <- pk2009_repEffect$CI_low


############ New

## We will examine if new effect is produced (Ignorance changes effect)

pk2009_newtest <- t.test(pk2009$response[pk2009$Scenario == "Neutral" & pk2009$QuestionType == "Dependent Variable"],
                         pk2009$response[pk2009$Scenario == "Ignorant" & pk2009$QuestionType == "Dependent Variable"])

pk2009_newEffect <- cohens_d(pk2009$response[pk2009$Scenario == "Neutral" & pk2009$QuestionType == "Dependent Variable"],
                         pk2009$response[pk2009$Scenario == "Ignorant" & pk2009$QuestionType == "Dependent Variable"])

## putting ignorance effects in the meta-analysis table

mtable$newEffect[mtable$study=="Phillips & Knobe, 2009"] <- pk2009_newEffect$Cohens_d
mtable$newEffectCIh[mtable$study=="Phillips & Knobe, 2009"] <- pk2009_newEffect$CI_high
mtable$newEffectCIl[mtable$study=="Phillips & Knobe, 2009"] <- pk2009_newEffect$CI_low

mtable$effectType[mtable$study=="Phillips & Knobe, 2009"] <- "d"
mtable$replication[mtable$study=="Phillips & Knobe, 2009"] <- "yes"
```

###  Reversing the direction of the effect size direction for those studies in which the norm manipulation has been shown to lead to a reduction in the DV rating
```{r}
flip.sign <- function(x, na.rm=FALSE) (x*-1)

orig.table <- mtable

m.table <- mtable %>% 
  mutate(direction = case_when(
    study == "Phillips & Knobe, 2009" ~ "Positive", # more forced in neutral vs immoral
    study == "Fraser & Knobe, 2008" ~ "Negative", # less causal in netural vs immoral
    study == "Cushman, Knobe, & Sinnott Armstrong, 2008" ~ "Negative", # less ended the life (vs. allowed) in neutral vs immoral
    study == "Knobe, 2003" ~ "Negative", # less acted intentionally in neutral vs. immoral
    study == "Phillips et al., 2015" ~ "Positive",  # happier in neutral vs. immoral
    study == "Young & Phillips, 2011, ship, active" ~ "Negative", # captain less forced sailor in neutral vs. immoral
    study == "Young & Phillips, 2011, ship, passive" ~ "Positive", # sailor more forced by captain in neutral vs. immoral
    study == "Young & Phillips, 2011, doctor, active" ~ "Negative", # Chief less forced doctor in neutral than immoral 
    study == "Young & Phillips, 2011, doctor, passive" ~ "Positive", # Doctor more forced by chief in neutral than immoral
    study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, battery, conjunctive" ~ "Negative", # less causal in neutral than immoral
    study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, battery, disjunctive" ~ "Positive", # more causal in netural than immoral
    study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, bridge, conjunctive" ~ "Negative", # less causal in neutral than immoral
    study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, bridge, disjunctive" ~ "Positive", # more causal in netural than immoral
    study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, motion detector, conjunctive" ~ "Negative",  # less causal in neutral than immoral
    study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, motion detector, disjunctive" ~ "Positive", # more causal in netural than immoral
    study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, computer, conjunctive" ~ "Negative", # less causal in neutral than immoral
    study == "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019, computer, disjunctive" ~ "Positive", # more causal in netural than immoral
    study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, chairman, desire" ~ "Negative", ## less desired in neutral than immoral
    study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, chairman, decide"  ~ "Negative", ## less decided in neutral than immoral 
    study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, manager, advocate"  ~ "Negative", ## less advocated in neutral than immoral 
    study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, manager, in favor of"  ~ "Negative", ## less in favor of in neutral than immroal 
    study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, CEO, opposed to" ~ "Positive", ## more opposed to in neutral than immoral  
    study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, bomb, intended to" ~ "Negative", ## less intended to in neutral than in immoral
    study == "Petitt & Knobe, 2009, bomb, wanted to" ~ "Neutral", ## this was a control question 
    study == "Szabo & Knobe, 2003, captain" ~ "Positive", ## more had to in neutral than in immoral
    study == "Szabo & Knobe, 2003, pens, professor" ~ "Negative", ## less had to in neutral than in immoral
    study == "Szabo & Knobe, 2003, bull's-eye" ~ "Positive", ## more had to in neutral than in immoral
    study == "Uttich & Lombrozo, 2010, gizmos" ~ "Negative", ## less intentional in neutral than violation
    study == "Uttich & Lombrozo, 2010, scrubs" ~ "Negative",  ## less intentional in neutral than violation
    study == "Uttich & Lombrozo, 2010, truck trailers" ~ "Negative" ## less intentional in neutral than violation
  ))%>%
  filter(study!="Petitt & Knobe, 2009, bomb, wanted to") %>% ## this was a control variable
  mutate_at(.vars=vars(repEffect:newEffectCIl), ~ case_when(
    direction=="Negative" ~ flip.sign(.),
    direction=="Positive" ~ (.)
  ))%>%
  mutate_at(.vars=vars(k_repEffect:cfe_newEffectCIl), flip.sign) %>% #reverse sign
  filter(replication=="yes") %>%  ##filter out non-replicated studies
  mutate(Paradigm=  #Create Judgment Domain Variable
           case_when(       
  str_detect(study, "Uttich & Lombrozo, 2010") ~ "Mental State",
  str_detect(study, "Szabo & Knobe, 2003") ~ "Modal Proxies",
  str_detect(study, "Petitt & Knobe, 2009") ~ "Mental State",
  str_detect(study, "Kominsky & Phillips, 2019") ~ "Causation",
  str_detect(study, "Fraser & Knobe, 2008") ~ "Causation",
  str_detect(study, "Phillips & Knobe, 2009") ~ "Freedom",
  str_detect(study, "Phillips et al., 2015") ~ "Happiness",
  str_detect(study, "Knobe, 2003") ~ "Mental State",
  str_detect(study, "Young & Phillips, 2011") ~ "Freedom",
  str_detect(study, "Cushman, Knobe, & Sinnott Armstrong, 2008") ~ "Doing vs. Allowing",
  FALSE ~ "Average"
  ) )
```

###### Meta-Analysis Dataframe

```{r}
# Convert mtable for meta-analysis
mtable <- m.table %>% filter(study!="Average")
  

m.df = mtable %>% 
  filter(replication!= "no") %>%     #only keep sucessfully replicated studies
  dplyr::select(repEffect, newEffect, k_repEffect, k_newEffect, sk_repEffect, sk_newEffect, cfa_repEffect, cfa_newEffect, cfe_repEffect, cfe_newEffect, study, Paradigm) %>%  # only keep effect sizes
  gather("Effect", "EffectSize", -study, -Paradigm) %>% #long format
  mutate(EpistemicState =  #Create Epistemic Condition Variable
           case_when(       
  str_detect(Effect, "rep") ~ "Intentional",
  str_detect(Effect, "new") ~ "Ignorant")) %>% 
  mutate(QuestionType = 
           case_when(      #Create Question Type Variable, case when order crucial
  str_detect(Effect, "sk_") ~ "Should_Know",
  str_detect(Effect, "k_") ~ "Knowledge_Check",
  str_detect(Effect, "cfa_") ~ "Action_CF",
  str_detect(Effect, "cfe_") ~ "Epistemic_CF",
  TRUE ~ "DV")) 


```

######Analysis Dependent Variable

```{r}
################ Analysis for DV Rating

DV_m0 <- lmer(EffectSize ~  1 + (1|study) + (EpistemicState|Paradigm), 
              m.df[m.df$QuestionType=="DV",], REML=F,
              control = lmerControl(calc.derivs =FALSE, optimizer = "bobyqa")) #to address convergence problems

DV_m1 <- lmer(EffectSize ~  EpistemicState + (1|study) + (EpistemicState|Paradigm),
              m.df[m.df$QuestionType=="DV",], REML=F,
              control = lmerControl(calc.derivs =FALSE, optimizer = "bobyqa"))

#Main Effect Epistemic State
anova(DV_m0,DV_m1)
summary(DV_m1)

```
